items.summary: Broome nurse Rebecca Smith says a looming ban on Doctors Without Borders due to registration issues will harm the most needy patients.

items.title: Federal parliament condemns attempted bombing at Perth/Boorloo Invasion Day rally
items.summary: Federal parliament officially condemns the attempted bomb attack at Perth's Invasion Day rally on its first sitting day, acknowledging the harm caused to the First Nations community.

items.title: Missing bushwalker David Elliot found after large-scale search in the Blue Mountains
items.summary: Authorities have found 71-year-old David Elliot alive following a multi-agency search when he failed to return from a 30-kilometre walk.

items.title: Piper James's family arrives in Australia to farewell 19yo who died on K'gari
items.summary: The parents and close friends of Piper James, 19, who died on K'gari (Fraser Island) last month, arrive in Australia to say their final farewells.

items.title: Perth man accused of backing Bondi attackers facing more firearms charges
items.summary: A Perth man who allegedly stated support for the Bondi shooters appears in court to face new firearms charges, with his lawyer flagging a bail application.

items.title: What I wish my manager knew about my mental health
items.summary: I've spent my working life in what I like to call the "honesty gap". This kind of creative disclosure became a necessary art form to maintain my work life.

items.title: Child safety officers took no action over 16-month-old’s worsening scabies, inquiry hears
items.summary: A 16-month-old child with "persistent" scabies did not receive a medical diagnosis for up to eight months due to inaction by Queensland's child safety department, an inquiry has heard.

items.title: Treasurer asks ASIC to restrict public access to company directors' home addresses
items.summary: The Australian Securities and Investments Commission moves to dramatically restrict public access to the residential addresses of company directors at the request of Treasurer Jim Chalmers.

items.title: South Sydney recruit David Fifita will lean on Wayne Bennett in an effort to rebuild his NRL career
items.summary: After a season lost to injury, newly minted South Sydney backrower David Fifita will lean on Rabbitohs coach Wayne Bennett in an effort to reclaim his status as one of the NRL's most dangerous players.

items.title: RBA lifts interest rates by 0.25pc as inflation rises
items.summary: RBA lifts interest rates by 0.25 per cent, to 3.85 per cent, after inflation rose "materially" in the second half of 2025.

items.title: Mortgage repayment calculator: How much extra you could be paying now the cash rate is 3.85 per cent
items.summary: Tell us your loan size, term and interest rate, and our mortgage repayment calculator will work out how much extra you may have to pay on your loan.

items.title: One Nation SA candidate Cory Bernardi says party will be the 'strongest voice of opposition'
items.summary: One Nation's lead candidate for South Australia Cory Bernardi has taken aim at the "two-party duopoly" in the state, with Pauline Hanson issuing a warning to Labor that her party would be "coming for your seats".

items.title: Parents of Brooke Day, 22, preparing to bring daughter home after Japan ski lift death
items.summary: The parents of a Queensland woman who died in a horror ski lift accident in Japan say she was an advanced snowboarder who had completed safety training.

items.title: NSW protest restrictions extended ahead of Israel president's visit
items.summary: The NSW Police commissioner announces restrictions on protests will be extended, ahead of planned demonstrations against the upcoming Sydney visit of Israel's president.

items.title: Cadia goldmine faces Supreme Court class action over contamination claims
items.summary: Landowners in central west NSW are behind an environmental class action against one of the world's biggest goldmines, alleging contamination of more than 2,000 properties.

items.title: Major potato company Zerella plans NT expansion with proposed Katherine seed farm
items.summary: Potatoes have not been grown in the Northern Territory at commercial scale for many years but could change if a planned seed potato venture goes ahead.

items.title: Bill and Hillary Clinton agree to testify before US House of Representatives on ties to Jeffrey Epstein
items.summary: The decision could head off a planned vote in the Republican-led House of Representatives to hold the two prominent Democrats in contempt of Congress, which could potentially lead to criminal charges.

items.title: Teachers in NSW schools face sack for hate speech in classrooms, premier says
items.summary: Teachers or school staff found to have breached bolstered NSW hate speech laws face tough sanctions, including the possibility of being fired.

items.title: Ley offers temporary exile for Nationals who breached shadow cabinet solidarity
items.summary: Sussan Ley has given David Littleproud a list of non-negotiable conditions, which if accepted could see the Coalition reunited before the end of the week.

items.title: Model revealed for Thriving Kids, the NDIS alternative for some children with developmental delay or autism
items.summary: The federal government has released the model for its Thriving Kids program, aimed at setting up services and supports run by states and territories outside the NDIS.

items.title: Nusantara Beat to bring 'psychedelic' take on Indonesian folk music to WOMADelaide
items.summary: All members of Amsterdam-based band Nusantara Beat have Indonesian heritage, so what better way to connect with those roots than through a very different take on the archipelago's traditional music?

items.title: Wallabies Rugby World Cup matches revealed against All Blacks, Hong Kong China and Chile
items.summary: Australia's home Rugby World Cup campaign will kick off against debutants Hong Kong China rather than bitter rivals New Zealand, who also feature in the same pool.

items.title: Sam Kerr is back for the Asian Cup, half a lifetime after winning it as a teenager
items.summary: Matildas captain Sam Kerr was just 16 when she helped the team win the Women's Asian Cup — their first, and to date only major trophy. Now she's leading the side at home, ready for another shot at glory.

items.title: Bright light blazing across Victorian skies believed to be Starlink satellite debris
items.summary: Keen observers reported a "massive, bright orange meteor" streaking across the sky, but one astronomer says it was likely to be space debris from a Starlink satellite.

items.title: Takeaways from the many mentions of Donald Trump in newly released Epstein files
items.summary: Donald Trump's name appears many times in the Epstein files — including on an FBI list of men who are named as subjects of "salacious information". So what have we learned about the US president?

items.title: Rare photo captures Christmas Island flying fox ferrying pup
items.summary: Often compared to a "teddy bear", advocates hope the special snap of an endangered flying fox carrying its pup will shine a light on the Christmas Island animal.

items.title: Christmas Island Flying Fox
items.summary: Follow the latest headlines from ABC News, Australia's most trusted media source, with live events, audio and on-demand video from the national broadcaster.

items.title: Denmark volunteers unite for coastal rehabilitation in wake of destructive tourist season
items.summary: Volunteers have completed phase one of their plan to restore the dunes at a beloved beach in regional WA where four-wheel drives have destroyed parts of the unique habitat.

items.title: Belinda Bencic and Elina Svitolina make history as two mothers sit in WTA top 10 for the first time
items.summary: For the first time in women's tennis, two mothers are ranked inside the world's top 10 simultaneously.

items.title: Tributes flow for long-time ABC host James Valentine after cancer forces retirement
items.summary: Listeners and former colleagues share treasured memories of a veteran broadcaster who has announced his retirement due to cancer.

items.title: Townsville health authorities report rise in pregnant women drinking
items.summary: A sharp rise in pregnant women drinking alcohol in Australia's largest northern city might be linked to the impact of last year's floods, health authorities say.

items.title: Behind the music of hit Australian indie game Hollow Knight: Silksong
items.summary: The video game soundtrack will be performed live for the first time by Orchestra Victoria at ACMI in February.

items.title: Aussie dollar climbs as RBA raises rates and leaves door open to more hikes — as it happened
items.summary: The Reserve Bank has hiked the cash rate 0.25 percentage points to 3.85 per cent, in its first rate rise in more than two years. The Aussie dollar rose back above 70 US cents after the decision.

items.title: Spanish figure skater Tomas-Llorenc Guarino Sabate says Minions music barred due to copyright issue
items.summary: Spanish figure skater Tomas-Llorenc Guarino Sabate says he will not be allowed to use the music from the Minions film franchise that he has skated to throughout the season at the Milano Cortina Games due to a copyright clearance issue.

items.title: Sita Walker's debut novel, In a Common Hour, takes place across a single hour at a state high school
items.summary: Sita Walker, an English teacher from Brisbane, explains how she tackled her first work of fiction, set in a single hour at a state high school.

items.title: Nationals sit on crossbench as PM grilled on cost of living — as it happened
items.summary: The Nationals have taken their seats on the crossbench in Question Time in the House of Representatives as the prime minister is grilled on the cost of living.

items.title: High Court to consider if Victoria's strict cap on individual political donations is discriminatory
items.summary: Two independent Victorian political candidates will ask the High Court to overturn a state law capping political donations to just under $5,000 but allowing an exception for the major parties.

items.title: ACT election data suggests neither Liberal nor Greens voters would want a coalition between the parties
items.summary: Greens voters overwhelmingly preference Labor over the Liberal Party across the country — and a look at the data from the 2024 ACT election suggests there's no reason to think that would be different in Canberra.

items.title: Children with brain cancer given hope in trial of personalised vaccines across eight Australian hospitals
items.summary: The four-year trial of about 70 children with "dismal prognoses" in eight hospitals across Australia will test the safety and effectiveness of the experimental treatment designed to harness the immune system to attack a child's tumour.

items.title: Josh Hazlewood to miss start of T20 World Cup, Mitch Marsh shrugs off Pakistan loss
items.summary: Speedster Josh Hazlewood will miss the early stages of the T20 World Cup as captain Mitch Marsh shrugs off Australia's lamentable capitulations in their warm-up series in Pakistan.

items.title: Victorian GPs to be trained to diagnose and treat ADHD in adults and children
items.summary: General practitioners in Victoria will soon be able to diagnose and treat ADHD in adults and children in a move the state government says will cut lengthy wait times and save thousands of dollars.

items.title: Australian Climate and Homelessness Alliance to help rough sleepers through extreme weather
items.summary: Tim knows firsthand the struggles of being homeless and navigating the weather, but it's experiences like his which will be the focus of a newly formed Australian Climate and Homelessness Alliance.

items.title: Citizen scientists look for hope as the algal bloom persists
items.summary: On Kangaroo Island – where the bloom has washed death ashore for almost a year – a group of citizen scientists are focusing their efforts on "what’s still out there".

items.title: Kangaroo Island's sea lions.
items.summary: Follow the latest headlines from ABC News, Australia's most trusted media source, with live events, audio and on-demand video from the national broadcaster.

items.title: Where do you spend your money? Tell us
items.summary: We are keen to understand how the cost of living is being felt across Australia. What are your biggest expenses? Are you making cutbacks? Do you afford yourself luxuries?

items.title: Dezi Freeman search continues as Victoria Police vow hunt 'will not stop'
items.summary: Victoria Police is continuing to search bushland in the Mount Buffalo National Park for traces of alleged gunman Dezi Freeman.

items.title: Amber Wraith's parents say medical professionals dismissed her suicidal thoughts
items.summary: A hospital has apologised to the parents of 19-year-old Amber Wraith, who took her own life in 2022. Her family hopes her death will prompt changes in the way mental health patients are treated.

items.title: Should I take a fish oil supplement for my heart, joints or mood?
items.summary: Fish oil is one of the most popular dietary supplements. It's often promoted for protecting the heart, boosting mood, reducing inflammation, and supporting overall health.

items.title: If the Reserve Bank starts the year with a rate hike, you can't say it didn't warn us
items.summary: Could RBA economists conceivably see inflation returning to target without a rate hike? We'll know this afternoon, and while it's not the dominant view, it's not a fringe one, either.

items.title: One Nation condemned for 'spot the Westerner' video
items.summary: A One Nation party official has filmed strangers on Melbourne's streets claiming the city "doesn't look like a Western nation at all".

items.title: How decluttering your digital streaming subscriptions can save you money this year
items.summary: With Australian households now holding an average of 3.7 digital entertainment subscriptions each, doing an audit on what you're using and whether it's providing value can be a good place to start when looking to cut costs.

items.title: In Antarctica's hostile environment, survival experts keep people safe
items.summary: Antarctica can be a dangerous place to live and work, but to mitigate the risks, a team of survival specialists is contracted to keep Australia's expeditioners safe on the ice.

items.title: Brisbane baby coffee assault tests Australia-China relations
items.summary: Sixteen months after a stranger poured scalding coffee over a baby in a Brisbane park, China's decision to send a working group to Australia marks the first tangible shift in a complicated case.

items.title: Trump administration to unveil rare-earths mineral stockpile to counter China
items.summary: A $US12 billion ($17.2 billion) investment from the US Export-Import Bank is attracting attention from major American car companies, and comes as Washington seeks to break China's dominance of resources key for military and computing applications.

items.title: Slow movement at Gaza border after Israel reopens Rafah crossing to Egypt in key step for truce
items.summary: Gaza's key Rafah border crossing with Egypt has been reopened. However, Israeli authorities have allowed fewer than 30 Palestinians to enter or exit the territory on the first day.

items.title: Dalai Lama's Grammy win slammed as 'anti-China' by Chinese government
items.summary: The 90-year-old, who lives in exile from his Tibetan homeland, says he accepts the award with "gratitude and humility" but it has sparked a furious response from China.

items.title: Sarah Court to be first female head of ASIC, Treasurer Jim Chalmers announces
items.summary: This position will give Ms Court significant influence over Australian corporate culture.

items.title: Cory Bernardi to contest SA state election for One Nation
items.summary: Former federal Liberal senator Cory Bernardi will lead One Nation's Legislative Council ticket at the upcoming state election in South Australia.

items.title: Is Dezi Freeman dead?
items.summary: Sarah Ferguson presents Australia's premier daily current affairs program, delivering agenda-setting public affairs journalism and interviews that hold the powerful to account. Plus political analysis from Laura Tingle.

items.title: Slain police officer Neal Thompson's sister says death would be 'too good' for Dezi Freeman
items.summary: The sister of one of the police officers shot dead in Victoria's high country last year tells the ABC that death would be "too good" an outcome for the accused gunman Dezi Freeman.

items.title: Mosman Park suspected double murder-suicide prompts calls for greater support for families with high-needs children
items.summary: A suspected murder-suicide in Perth has put the spotlight on families with high needs children, with speculation that the Clune family were not getting the support they needed in the lead up to their deaths.

items.title: Wadeye traditional owners worry community violence is escalating
items.summary: Traditional owners from the NT's second largest Indigenous community Wadeye are appealing for more support to end a month of attacks on houses, and fights involving up to 100 armed people in the streets.

items.title: Boy, 13, makes 'superhuman' swim to save family swept out to sea in Geographe Bay
items.summary: A 13-year-old boy has been hailed a hero after swimming four hours through rough seas to get help for his mother and two siblings, who were swept out to sea on an inflatable paddleboard in WA's South West.

items.title: Grammys 2026: Bad Bunny, Billie Eilish slam ICE at music's biggest awards
items.summary: The 2026 Grammys blended protest, celebration and cultural change as artists confronted powers that be, embraced diversity and reshaped the night's biggest awards.

items.title: 'Lucky' fishermen rescued after boat fire near Binalong Bay, Tasmania
items.summary: Two boaties stranded at sea for eight hours after their tinnie caught fire chose a survival plan police described as "highly unrecommended" — to set it on fire again.
